about.summary: We present DRaWR, a network-based method for ranking genes or properties related to a given gene set. Such related genes or properties are identified from among the nodes of a large, heterogeneous network of biological information. Our method involves a random walk with restarts, performed on an initial network with multiple node and edge types, preserving more of the original, specific property information than current methods that operate on homogeneous networks. In this first stage of our algorithm, we find the properties that are the most relevant to the given gene set and extract a subnetwork of the original network, comprising only the relevant properties. We then rerank genes by their similarity to the given gene set, based on a second random walk with restarts, performed on the above subnetwork.

name: r-drawr
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '1.0.1' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-drawr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/DRaWR_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/DRaWR/DRaWR_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 10bfdd9afe193f5c259d5c3af9286c842e08e67a8b24ee89616688f6f967cddd

build:
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-matrix
    - r-rocr
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-matrix
    - r-rocr

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('DRaWR')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('DRaWR')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=DRaWR
  license: GPL-2.0-only
  summary: We present DRaWR, a network-based method for ranking genes or properties related to
    a given gene set. Such related genes or properties are identified from among the
    nodes of a large, heterogeneous network of biological information. Our method involves
    a random walk with restarts, performed on an initial network with multiple node
    and edge types, preserving more of the original, specific property information than
    current methods that operate on homogeneous networks. In this first stage of our
    algorithm, we find the properties that are the most relevant to the given gene set
    and extract a subnetwork of the original network, comprising only the relevant properties.
    We then rerank genes by their similarity to the given gene set, based on a second
    random walk with restarts, performed on the above subnetwork.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: DRaWR
# Title: Discriminative Random Walk with Restart
# Version: 1.0.1
# Authors@R: person("Charles", "Blatti", email = "blatti@illinois.edu", role = c("aut", "cre"))
# Author: Charles Blatti [aut, cre]
# Maintainer: Charles Blatti <blatti@illinois.edu>
# Description: We present DRaWR, a network-based method for ranking genes or properties related to a given gene set. Such related genes or properties are identified from among the nodes of a large, heterogeneous network of biological information. Our method involves a random walk with restarts, performed on an initial network with multiple node and edge types, preserving more of the original, specific property information than current methods that operate on homogeneous networks. In this first stage of our algorithm, we find the properties that are the most relevant to the given gene set and extract a subnetwork of the original network, comprising only the relevant properties. We then rerank genes by their similarity to the given gene set, based on a second random walk with restarts, performed on the above subnetwork.
# Depends: R (>= 3.0)
# License: GPL-2
# LazyData: true
# Imports: Matrix, ROCR
# RoxygenNote: 5.0.1.9000
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2016-02-04 15:59:44 UTC; root
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2016-02-05 00:55:30
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.2
